ltl2rabin

Class Slave

  • Object
    • ltl2rabin.Automaton<T,U>
      • ltl2rabin.RabinAutomaton<List<MojmirAutomaton.State<PropEquivalenceClass,Set<String>>>,Set<String>>
        • ltl2rabin.Slave

  • public class Slave
extends RabinAutomaton<List<MojmirAutomaton.State<PropEquivalenceClass,Set<String>>>,Set<String>>
    Slaves are Rabin automata that are constructed for a G-subformula. States of GDRAs have a collection of Slave states. Slaves provide the GDRA with valuable information that is used to construct the acceptance condition of the GDRA. A Slave.State represents a ranking of MojmirAutomaton.States. The failMerge and succeed methods generate the acceptance sets for a given rank and set of G-subformulas.

      • failMerge

        public ImmutableSet<Slave.Transition> failMerge(int rank,
                                                Set<G> curlyG)
        This method returns the combination of fail and merge(i) for a given rank i and a set of G subformulas. It makes use of computing caches, so the first call will be the (by far) most expensive.
        Parameters:
        rank - The requested merging rank
        curlyG - The set of G subformulas that hold
        Returns:
        The union of fail and merge(i)

      • succeed

        public ImmutableSet<Slave.Transition> succeed(int rank,
                                              Set<G> curlyG)
        This method returns the set of succeeding transitions for a given rank i and a set of G subformulas. It makes use of computing caches, so the first call will be the (by far) most expensive.
        Parameters:
        rank - The rank the transitions succeed at
        curlyG - The set of G subformulas that hold
        Returns:
        The set of succeeding transitions
